beer.name: Grimbergen Blonde
beer.description: Grimbergen is the brand name of a variety of Belgian abbey beers. Originally made by Norbertine monks in the Belgian town of Grimbergen, it is now brewed by two different breweries in Belgium and France.

comments.author: User 1
comments.content: I enjoyed this beer a lot!

comments.author: User 2
comments.content: Not really a newcomer to this style of beer, so I can definitely say this brew is very enjoyable!

comments.author: User 3
comments.content: A bit pricey eh, but you only life once, right?

beer.name: Guinness
beer.description: A dark Irish dry stout that originated in the brewery of Arthur Guinness at St. James's Gate, Dublin, Ireland, in 1759.

comments.author: User 4
comments.content: The Guinness we all know and love!

comments.author: User 5
comments.content: Never understood the love for dark beer. Definitely not for me.

comments.author: User 6
comments.content: You can tell a good beer with just one sip, but it is better to be sure!

beer.name: Matiné Session IPA
beer.description: This is a beer that has a massive hop punch but in a more sessionable package... meaning you can have more than one and still go about your business. The selection of hops deliver flavors of tangerine, passion fruit and peach in a drinkable package.

comments.author: User 7
comments.content: Esta cerveja é excelente! Deixa para trás um suave aroma a tangerina no paladar.

comments.author: User 8
comments.content: It is a portuguese india pale ale crafted with care and passion.

beer.name: King JJJuliusss
beer.description: To continue with our 4th Anniversary celebration, we brewed an extra kettle hop and extra dry hopped version of King Julius! The result is an incredibly intense citrus hop blast unlike anything we've experienced here at Tree House. Mango, orange, and sweet grapefruit are predominant in the aroma with hints of pineapple and blended tropical fruit juice. The taste mirrors the aroma with a juicy mouthfeel and a proper bitterness. Fluffy. This beer challenges the sense and rewards the palate as it warms in the glass. Complex, raw, and beautiful, the amplified King is a beer we are excited to share with you to celebrate four years of Tree House. Thank you!

beer.name: Chemin de Croix
beer.description: Tastes very English. Old style India Porter.

beer.name: Equinoxe du Printemps
beer.description: Équinoxe du Printemps (French for spring equinox) is the quintessential marriage of two great traditions: beer brewing in Scotland, and maple syrup production in Quebec. At the first draught, the mouth is overcome by woody, malty flavours, sustained by a discrete touch of sweetness. The aftertaste brings about the flavours of maple, which are sufficiently present to be appreciated, but never overwhelming the typical flavours of a Scotch Ale.

comments.author: Quebec_Mike_99
comments.content: Cloudy taste. Fusion of earthly aromas. Medium and oily, with sparkling accents.

comments.author: GDLOSH_U
comments.content: Flavor of wood, smoke and caramel. The aroma was malty and leafy, with some dark fruit taste in the aftermatch.

comments.author: jessica_from_quebec
comments.content: Le gout est relativement amer, moins sucré et je sens un peu trop l’alcool dans la bouche.

comments.author: danish_beer_master
comments.content: Bitter modtate sød modrate. Livlig oile.
